name: Kingston Flying Club
about: The Kingston Flying Club, established in 1929, is a premier flight training institution in South-eastern Ontario. Accredited by the Ministry of Training, Colleges and Universities as a registered Private Career College, the club has a rich history of training pilots, from WWII veterans to current CF-18 pilots. Located at the Kingston airport, the club offers a range of programs including Airline Transport License, Commercial Pilot License, Private Pilot License, and Recreational Pilot License, along with additional ratings such as Instructor, Multi-Engine, and Instrument Flight Rules. The club's professional staff and excellent training facilities, including a variety of approaches like ILS, LOC BC, RNAV, and NDB, provide students with comprehensive aviation training. With a focus on flexibility and customization, the Kingston Flying Club helps aspiring pilots achieve their aviation goals in a scenic and supportive environment.
services:
["Private Pilot License
Commercial Pilot License
Airline Transport Pilot
Flight Instructor (CFI / FI)
Flight Instructor - Instrument (CFII / IRI)
Instrument Rating (IR)
Multi-Engine Rating
Night Rating"]
